name: Nostos Apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all of the wonderful reviews on tripadvisor and getting a personal recommendation from someone who had stayed at Nostos, I was very excited for this part of our stay in Greece. Unfortunately this was not the case, it was the worst night of our trip.
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we arrived at Nostos, after checking in, we were lead down a set of stairs on the left side of the property. It seemed far away from everything and now I know why. The room we were shown was dark, smelly and in need of a paint job. It had mold like spots throughout the room. Also the air conditioning was broken. It did not look anything like the pictures as shown on the website and definitely was not worth 200 EUR per night.
reviews.title: Our Perfect 3 Nights at Nostos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We asked to change room but due to the high season none were available at Nostos nor anywhere nearby. We were wondering if the whole hotel was like this or was it just our room. After making friends with people at the pool, we asked to see their room after saying how disappointed we were in ours. Their room was bright, clean and very nice. They actually had a look at our room afterwards and couldn't believe what a difference there was.
reviews.title: Paradise!

likes.liked: — the view and the charm of the room
likes.disliked: — My son's bead was a little narrow; he slept on the couch; we put the mattress on the floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are booking at this hotel, I would make them guarantee that your room is on the side where the office and the pool are. It is not worth the risk of staying in a nasty room when you are in one of the most romantic places on earth. It ruined the night for us. Luckily for us, the next day we checked into the resort next door, La Perla Villas, which had bright, clean rooms and one of the best pools in Oia. For only 20 EUR more.
reviews.title: Heaven...a cliffside view!

likes.disliked: — Walking the stairs...but they were worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did receive a discount on our room due to the air conditioner being broken at Nostos, but we can never get back that day that was ruined in disppointment with the room and a night spent in 95 degree heat. We were disappointed as well that the manager would not admit that our room was of a different quality than the others.
reviews.title: Really fantastic!!!

likes.liked: — It was just a perfect as it was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Exceeded all expectations! The rooms are so unique, and each one is so different! We were with a party of 6, and we all were awestruck with the views, accomodations, and service. The rooms are huge, the place is incredibly clean, and the service from Anna, Christos and Andreas is wonderful. There is a resident cat that everyone falls in love with, named Cowabunga, and she had 4 kittens she was tending to while we were there. The pool was fun, the breakfasts were great, (again, with a view that is so serene, you have to be pinched to besure it is real!) There is lots of room to visit with others in your party while you enjoy spectacular views! The steps up and down to the apartments were a challenge with luggage, but the end result of being perched on the edge of the island overlooking views that have to be experienced to understand are well worth it. We communicated directly with Andreas on the internet, and he is right on top of things, and very easy to deal with, and knows English very well. His recomendations for places to see, and eat were right on, but I would definately suggest the Caldera walk from Fiera, and also the walk down the steps to the port town for an evening dinner. The walk on the Caldera is about 7 or 8 miles, and the walk down the steps is about 265 steps, but if you are up to it, it is Well Worth the effort!
reviews.title: Truly a once in a lifetime experience!

likes.liked: — Felt like royalty with the views service and location
likes.disliked: — About 4 flights of stairs to the local attractions and transportation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just come back from 2 weeks' stay at Nostos Apartments. We have visited many Greek island resorts, and have to say that Santorini/Oia/Nostos Apartments is the best by far! The team that run the Nostos Apartments complex; Andreas, Chris and Anna are great. Andreas (the manager), is very knowledgeable about the area and can be counted on to give extremely good advice. Chris and Anna are also always on hand.
reviews.title: Paradise found

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nostos Apartments are located the nearest to the Caldera and therefore have the most steps to climb down to, but this shouldn't put you off as the views are well worth it.
reviews.title: Lovely location, funky rooms

likes.disliked: — Steps up and down - an occupational hazard of Santorini!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast in the picturesque breakfast room is enjoyable with the most spectacular view you can imagine. The pool, although small, is delightful and because of the location of the apartment complex the view from the pool across the Caldera is second to none.
reviews.title: Nostos All about relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oia is a stunningly beautiful resort, although quite pricey, make sure you explore when the cruise liners aren't in town to avoid the crowds. The colourful architecture is stunning and the pedestrianised main street is a bonus.
reviews.title: The key here is the Staff

likes.disliked: — So many steps to go up and down.... not the hotel's fault, that's just nature! :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival
reviews.title: A few tweaks will make all the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Nostos, having spent 7 days there. Andreas organised a taxi for us in advance, great, and this was waiting for us on arrival but there was a bit of a delay as the driver seemed to be organising other people at the airport.
reviews.title: Paradise!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly Chris from Nostos was waiting for us at the top of the steps, welcomed us and carried the luggage down, showed us the apartment and where breakfast is served 8 to 11etc. The view at breakfast is gorgeous overlooking the sea with huge open windows. Breakfast is continental, croissants, tea, coffee, Greek yoghurt, cheese, ham etc.
reviews.title: Poor attitude with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Couldn't Have Been Nicer

likes.liked: — View, Staff, Charming rooms and decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely; very romantic, we stayed in room 104, one big studio really even though Andreas calls it a one bed apartment. All the living space in 104 is one big room with a separate shower room. The kitchen area was fully equipped although we did not use it but was absolutely fine. The room had a tv with a few channels, BBC world being the only English station, no big deal for us but others may want more. A/C was great and needed. No dvd or stereo etc. The shower room has a hand held shower as does room 103. Small toiletries are provided also. Daily maid service, provided by the lovely Anna, towels changed etc. The balcony in room 104 is partitioned from 103 by half a wall and the plants and flowers. There were 2 deckchairs and 2 other seats, small table and umbrella, very picturesque and candles are lit every night around all the villas and the pool so it looks fab. All villas are on the side of the caldera and views are great we could see the sea from the bed. Sitting outside the wall is a bit high for you to get the view although there are lovely flowers around.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were "blown away' when we got to this property. Chris was waiting for our taxi at the top of the road & he was very helpful with our luggage. The rooms were gorgeous & each studio had their own private large balcony area. The pool was small but perfectly located on the edge of the cliff - almost an infinity pool. The breakfast was excellent & the dining room had the most spectacular views. We really enjoyed our stay here which we thought was good value for the high standard of accommodation it was.
reviews.title: The views were amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four days of our honeymoon here in August 2007 and it was quite simply the best place either one of us has every stayed in our lives.
reviews.title: The best place I've ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took me several weeks to decide where to stay in Santorini... Oia, Fira, etc... Once I settled on on Oia (I heard it was quieter), it took another few weeks to figure out where to stay. So many places looked great. And in truth, in person many of the places looked great, too. I think Oia is one of those places where you really can't go wrong (as long as you pick the Caldera side). Having said that, we were SUPER pleased with our pick of Nostos. I read great things about it here and loved the pictures and the price....so we took a chance.
reviews.title: Nostos was waaaay to rustic (read: midevil) or me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a cab from the port to the hotel, which Andreas had set up for us. (warning....you will most likely have to share with others... they want to pick up as many people as possible) and the price was reasonable (I don't remember what it was). The ride took about thirty minutes or so.
reviews.title: Andreas and Chris make Nostos special.

likes.liked: — the excellent location over hanging the calderra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got to Oia, our cab let us off at the base of the town... we were met by a very nice gentleman from the hotel who was waiting for us (even though we were late!) and who carried both of our heavy bags down the 86 steps to the hotel. We were instantly met by Andreas, who led us promptly to our room. I can honestly say that my jaw DROPPED when I saw our room. It was one of those cases where we were saying "oh please let this balcony be ours...please let this balcony be ours...." and it WAS!!! The cave-like room was pretty cool, temperature wise, which was especially great during the hottest part of the day. It was extremely quiet and very spacious. The little kitchen was SO CUTE. Because it was our honeymoon, Andreas stopped by with a bottle of champagne.
reviews.title: Had a great time

likes.disliked: — all of the stairs, but actually not that bad

description: Small settlement located in OIA on the Santorini Island,consist of 8 units for 2 till 5 persons, reception, bar and pool facilities. Settlement is situated on the edge of the Volcano crater, overlooking the see and islets around. Each unit is fully equipped and can work as an independent bungalow (fully equipped kitchen, terrace etc.) Cave-like looking apartments, just 3-5 minutes walking distance from the center of the village and shopping center, but on the really calm area... relaxing and romantic atmosphere
